title: Help me ples, my PC is being dumb (freezes without significant resource usage)
body:
Okay so I'm having major issues with my PC that basically prevent me from using it.
1. Freezes until I'm forced to restart every time I use something intense (LoL, WoW, even YouTube sometimes)
2. Chkdsk used to stop in its tracks and not finish, last time tho chkdsk /f worked to the end but only lasted 10 minutes.
3. Before this mess, I already had started having connection issues that other devices didn't have.
4. Avast!+Malwarebytes+CCleaner can't find shit (except my router having issues)
5. Some programs need several clicks to start, or start one process per click...
6. The CD unit does its clicky on startup thing several minutes later than it used to.
7. Ctrl+alt+del/ctrl+shift+esc very rarely work, never during freezes. Twice I found myself in front of a different UI than normal for the task manager
8. When I managed to get my Task Manager out, the resource consumption was average at worst.
9. It's winter so it can't be heat.
10. I already had to throw away two hard disks last summer, my original one and the brand new, freshly installed replacement.
11. I have about 400 free GB on my disk.

This sounds like malware, but the holy trinity can't find any irregularities...

replies.body:
Since you're having issues outside of League, it definitely sounds like a bigger issue such as a corrupt OS or hardware failure. I'd strongly recommend having your PC checked out by a professional before this issue potentially gets worse. 

Let me know if you have any questions.

Also I was asking because I don't really have the munsmuns for a professional right now...
I got it to work a bit better by uninstalling everything Blizzard (given that I had installed 60 GB of stuff after it had already started to be clunky...), running all of my tools again and reinstalling, but it's still overheating in december.

If you'd like, we can escalate this to our tech team so we can assist with running some basic hardware tests to figure out what's specifically in danger zones and what should be focused in order to resolve this. I recommend reaching out to our tech team in a [**support ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) and request help in testing your hardware for overheating/failure.

Let me know if you run into any issues with this.
I'd guess hardware failure since I already wiped and changed disk and reinstalled an empty OS twice...
Sounds like you need to reset your OS. I advise backing up all your files before you proceed.
